description: The scene depicts a darkly humorous absurdity where triumphant Vikings, having just attacked a burning castle, are shown carrying a cow as their loot, subverting typical expectations of Viking plunder. Further surrealism is introduced by a dog tied to the mast of their longship, seemingly acting as an unhappy, live figurehead, replacing the usual fearsome carving. The juxtaposition of the standard violent raid imagery with the mundane cow and the bizarre dog figurehead creates the comedic effect. The dog's predicament adds a layer of pathos to the overall absurdity.
caption: We're home! And what a haul!
